kjD4kYQ8UZvL7hSRF9vtug.text: They finally have empanadas, but sadly they weren't my favorite. We ordered the chicken and the ground beef which were okay. They are made with the same ingredients as the arepas, so I prefer the arepas bc they have more flavor. I ordered the Pabellon arepa this time which has shredded beef, plantains, black beans and cheese. This is a great combination!

GMTiLwuUDVRpt2Y74CPODw.text: Unsuspecting delicious find. Even as a vegan, I found some great meals. Even dessert! Jonathan was a great server and host too. Great service and great food :)

qd4iukY_ez-gzVYBC0aiUA.text: Delicious food! Great service! Fantastic Venezuelan sandwich with plantains on it. Same Mexican menu as Bea's. Authentic chicken tacos rocked Kennth's world. Their homemade hot sauce is really hot. Use sparingly. Our young waiter from Venezuela was thoughtful, kind, and informative. Kenneth has been eating at this location for 30 years. These are the best restaurant proprietors Banksville Road has ever seen.

tUBI1kGFhKMYez5YgRxL_w.text: WOW!!! We wanted to eat something different and exceptional and Pabellon   Exceeded our expectations. The Arepos were outstanding and one is very "filling." The guacamole was thick, creamy and tasty. Great service and the waiters were over the top respectful. We will be back!

conlgPW-5PzLRkkV50GIHA.text: The arepas are awesome, especially the Pabellon. The salsa is delicious with a different style than I'm used to.  Friendly staff, quick service.

O9c_GmNWAdldl-AzYfXlAA.text: So so good. We had multiple arepas, tacos, and the ocean enchiladas. We will be back!

3QM1dd-H9wWrT_gHd1LmOw.text: Love, love, love the food here and the people aim to please!  The arepas are amazing, the empanadas are delicious, the flan is the best I've ever had, the tres leches cake is divine, and let's not forget the plantains, cooked perfectly and with cheese on top!  We haven't tried the Mexican menu yet, but we'll get there once we work our way through the arepa menu.  Please go try Pabellon -- give it your business -- let's keep something new and different and delicious!  Try it, you won't be sorry!

kW-VshbLANmA1Dzt7yuKhw.text: What wonderful food and drinks, the dinner was so good we visited for lunch later in the week!   Great service, amazing food, and surprisingly great prices!   Please put one in Pittsburgh!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4-XuKaU7RBmLiUMQ34Iyhw.text: I just picked up two orders from this new restaurant and made the deliveries. (I'm an UberEats driver.) It smelled heavenly, the staff were very friendly, & the place was clean. I can't wait to check it out as a customer!

JzCglf0YWmqjwOtlt_16vg.text: Hot damn this place smacks HARD. As a Hispanic, I can verify this place is legit and reallllyyyyy good. We had arepas, empanadas, guacamole, tostones, and guasacaca, and ALL of it was amazing. The portions are small, and yet, super filling!

jH3YXUHWhWoSnVQDOCdQKQ.text: This place is soooooo good. Wasn't going to stop for lunch...just pick up a menu. The didn't have any take outs so the guy just rips apart one of theirs and hands it to me. As I'm looking at it I decide to jump in. I was blown away by how friendly the staff was and more blown by how good the food is. I ordered a Venezuelan taco with black beans and white cheese. The 'tortilla' was unbelievable. The filling savory. The salsas out of this world fresh. Some of the most authentic Latino food I've had on the east coast. I asked for hot sauce and instead of them plopping down some usual bottle of Tapitio or whatever, they brought homemade stuff blazing with fresh habernaro. I cannot wait to go back and bring some friends. Not sure if it's BYOB but why wouldn't it be? There is no bar so if that's your thing...see my last sentence.

5WLvkxsU_fearn2fZfNZsA.text: Ordered deilvery on a whim, having never eaten here before.  Arrived extremely fast and was AMAZING!  Mouth-watering and delicious steak and shredded beef.  The arepa were the perfect texture and consistency.  We ordered an empanada (new favorite), a Pittsburgh Burrito,  and a plate with seasoned steak, beans, rice, fried plantains, and cheese.  The empanada came with a crema sauce that was divine!  I could easily eat a vat of it! The boyfriend loved the fried plantains and is making sure we order a full portion of it next time!  Highly recommend and can't wait to go try it in person!

dcZ3I8pAtzWmUXptcdLo9w.text: We all loved this place. Got a burrito, an empanada, nachos and plantains. It was all good, especially the plantains. We will go back!

O-1ULpQ3NfLsIUAwqeunKQ.text: I tried their signature dish, a beef arepa which was delicious. Just the right amount for lunch, but I ordered a flan for dessert which was also tasty. Alejandro, the waiter, was very hospitable.

Sa7WfwjgCMF1l0agbWDcTQ.text: Found out about this place by accident, but what a find it is! Decided to visit them on a weekday to avoid the crowds. Had never had an arepa before, so I had the one named after the restaurant. It was delicious! Also, don't leave without trying the Tres Leches Cake! An excellent finishing touch to a great meal! The staff are friendly and attentive. I'll definitely be back!

pXDP0HgAhunonDVUSBuJGw.text: The food here is authentic Venezuelan street and Home cooked style  food. I like to keep my reviews short ,so in closing I'll just say it's "good good good".

TLjzFNlf60wbwaybxqgTag.text: Great little place with really good food (no drinks).  Might be our new 'go-to' dinner place pre-Pens game!  Quick and friendly service as well.

UYeqCKdkrq-siRxYpDHdbQ.text: We had family in from out-of-town and decided to give this place a chance for take out. Everyone commented that it was the best Mexican food they've had in awhile. We will definitely be ordering more from here.

Tsp5LBTVlr8dkX2RPdRcYg.text: Incredible food! Came here for lunch with my fiance and we tried the tostones (fried plantains), beef empanadas, arepa llanera, and arepa reina pepiada. Everything was amazing! I'm so glad we live close by- one of my favorite restaurants!

hKYtvqJSe_9H_ErKJU3zHw.text: Outstanding - a huge upgrade from Beas taco. The entire group of 4 of us loved the dinner

bC_eu_PDUs-o0QSxZ7HuTQ.text: We stopped here when in town for business. The food was great! It was authentic Mexican and the portions were filling. The service was outstanding!! The owner was extremely kind and hospitable!

CY5Oqx4tXyUC5CbYA7akyg.text: Oh my, the best Mexican food I have ever eaten!  I am in Mexico frequently, the quality of the ingredients, the authenticity, the freshness puts our friends south of border to shame!

a069nTaBuLF4lEjcTn68Tg.text: Stopped in for dinner on a Sunday evening. Our table had a sampling of Arepas - chorizo, chicken and beef - which we split and shared. They were generous in size, hot, freshly made, and each was delicious. I ordered the Tacozuela, which as another reviewer noted, is a delight you've just got to try. Wonderful combination of flavors and the taco shells have just the right bite/give. Everyone at the table enjoyed their meals, though the burritos may not have played to Pabellon's strengths. Hint: order Venezuelan dishes.  I know this review has a lot of gaps, because I do not have a menu to refer to, but the spirit of the review is to encourage you to stop and try the food. Your taste buds will thank you!

LgGstn-mLKFEPvQhHluxIA.text: Awesome! Had the Pabellon Arepa and it was great. I ate it so fast I almost ordered another. Definitely come check this place out!

i_MPLL296cRnDTnSsBE1vA.text: Ordered the chips with choriqueso, tricolor burrito, and an arepa. Overall, the food was very tasty with lots of flavor. A dessert of flan finished the meal off nicely. We're definitely coming back again to try more of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flan

R-wpTskSqlSYxXfRoz2KIw.text: Wow. I ordered delivery and got the Super Burrito with chicken, not for the faint of heart. This is HUGE, you will definitely want to share. Everything inside tasted really fresh and I love the melted cheese on top. You will not be disappointed. Really yummy and filling.

n8txwqYmsI1aoP_0huKq2A.text: One of my favorite places!! Delicious food, great service and a kind staff. The arepas here are some of the best I've ever had!

tRNTKEvT9qdlYHbDZxHzFg.text: Wonderful live singer  was there.  I also liked the arepa I got.   Very friendly staff :) byob a plus!  Sweet Plantains on point.

z4aEplBpISs5Zb2vDnmlWA.text: I had 2 traditional tacos (ground beef), chips and salsa, a side of guacamole, and the Jarritos fruit punch soda. Everything was delicious!!! LOVED the traditional tacos. Chips were served warm and were great. The salsa is a mild salsa, but so good!   We ordered a side of fried plantains and they were so yummy!! We will definitely be back!! I am worried the location isn't great, so make a point to stop in!!

pse4tNF3GwSMs9fQbYupsA.text: The arepas, a traditional Venezuelan dish, are wonderful. I suggest trying one with the sweet plantains. The savory and sweet combo is delicious.  One heads up, the kitchen is pretty slow. Just set your expectations to invest some of your time to get a very tasty meal.  The people are get kind.  Quick summary: slow, delicious food from warm-hearted folks.

007B4XIU7pOjmHTzS2wj_g.text: Outstanding Mexican/Venezuelan food!! I heard about Pabellon on Yelp as a "hot and new" restaurant, so I decided to give it a try!! I was highly impressed!  I came on a Friday night and it was not crowded at all, so I was seated right away. Because Pabellon is so new, they are working on finalizing a menu with empanadas, fresh juice, etc. They did have an arepa menu and a Mexican menu when I went, so I was excited about that! For the appetizer, my fam shared the chips, salsa, and guacamole. The chips were warm (I love warm tortilla chips), and the guacamole and salsa tasted great. For my dinner, I got the "Pabellon" arepa, which has shredded beef, white cheese, black beans, and sweet plantains. It was delicious. The perfect amount of savory filling plus a hint of sweetness from the plantains- definitely hits the spot. They also put a cute little Venezuela flag in the arepa, which was a cool touch to the arepa's presentation. My sister got a "Super Burrito" with shrimp, and believe me, it definitely was a super burrito. The burrito was GIGANTIC!!!! It was probably one of the biggest burritos I have ever seen. Finally, we all had dessert, which was fantastic. I had the flan, which was creamy and sweet.  I would recommend Pabellon if you are in the mood for authentic, fresh, and yummy Mexican/Venezuelan food! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flan
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My sister&#39;s ginormous burrito!! :O
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pabellon arepa- love the cute Venezuela flag

FA9VuIU9Cps29WdNS7DWuA.text: The arepas are amazing.  I've never had them where the shell is actually crispy.  The Pabellon arepa comes with a lime aoili which is amazing.   Tacos and burritos are good too, same fare as when it was Bea but with some additions

YWebEQsnNF8S0TaNG0P_hw.text: I had the Arepa and the Tacozeula. Both very tasty. What set the 5 star was the care the service took in preparing the dish while recommending tweaks based on allergies. Will go back!

kTAtZUclLVeCcNhB2hqDIg.text: Great first impressions!  I went a few weeks back, before they had the Pabellon sign up, and before it had appeared yet on Yelp.  Even so, I noted how much cleaner and welcoming the place was with the new ownership--Bea's had really declined in both respects over time.  I believe I was interacting with one of the new owners, who was super friendly and seemed excited himself to be starting up the restaurant and exposing us to Venezuelan food.  Speaking of....haven't yet tried the arepas--which weren't yet on the menu at that point--but the tacos were very promising. I ordered three.  Echoing some of the other reviewers, the tacozuela was my clear favorite, and make me excited to try some of the Venezuelan options when I go back.  Also had carnitas and al pastor tacos, and both were solid.    For both of these other two tacos, they included rice and beans on the taco, which seems a carryover from Bea's. I've eaten at many many taquerias in Arizona, California, and Mexico, and Bea's was the first to include rice and beans as a default addition to all tacos.  Seemed like a way to bulk the tacos up, but the actual meat topping tends to get lost, so I'm not a fan of this approach.  That said, all the components on the tacos were fresh and tasty!  Looking forward to my next visit to Pabellon, especially now that the Venezuelan menu is up and running!

G8xOdGG7mNyRb_C24czxjQ.text: Not really sure.. I have tried the Venezuela dish and i asked for the most ask popular dish. I chicken was green and I think if it wasn't for that I could eat more of it. But the plantains were very good!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OBIK5xd_ZrWyA-Z-L603Vg.text: Arepas as good as they get!  I got the arepa pepiadas and the pabellon... service was great.  I wish they were closer to home to come more often

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Arepa pabellón y arepa pepiada

kR2usaTRxP7Q_tvm5kocOg.text: Yum!  Fresh tasting and great service.  Tried the Venezuelan menu and wasn't disappointed.  Would definitely recommend this place.  Yelp is always spot on!

yT427MeaJE5_zCsgOJqz8g.text: Great food! I was severely blown away by their Super Burrito and how massive it was! So delicious! I'm used to burritos looking like the size that the Chido Burrito came in. As for the Tacozuela, I've never had a taco that had plantains in it before. Boy, was I missing out. Lastly, the Tres Leches was hella bomb. I ordered and GrubHub delivered. It was a pretty cold day out so the food wasn't piping hot but given the travel time I didn't expect it to be hot or even warm like it would be if I were to dine at the restaurant (nothing that my microwave couldn't fix). I'll just have to stop in next time. And oh yes... there will be a next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 3. Tres Leches (so damn good)
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 1. Chido Burrito (wrapped in foil) 5. Super Burrito (massive!)  8. Tacozuela

zJG3n1wZGXGGmpdCSpvF1A.text: This is a wonderful local restaurant!  It is nothing fancy but the food is first rate.  I got an arepa and the taco-zuela - both were fantastic.  My SO ordered the chimichanga and it was awesome as well.  There is no bar here but they have great bottled Mexican sodas.  Probably the best part of the dinner, however, was the warm and friendly staff.  Visit this restaurant for the unassuming atmosphere and terrific food!

K2Asn001zWyPLALfbc4qWw.text: Best food we've had in Pittsburgh!!! We had amazing empanadas with this green sauce that they make themselves that is to die for. Also had an absolutely delightful arepa and the pabellon criollo plate (it was so good i didn't want to stop eating, but it was a lot of food so I took half of it to go). The place itself doesn't look like anything special, but who cares? The food is so delicious and way better than many fancy places we've been to. Also, very reasonably priced and the people who worked there (maybe the owners?) were so nice. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

ImqiT0nC67CnU_qKwzcPXg.text: I ordered through Grub Hub.   I became hooked on Bea Taco town and was devastated when they closed.   Pabellon filled the void in my taco-deprived tummy.   The pork taco was simple and yet one of the most delicious tacos I've ever had.   I prefer simple, slow-roasted lean meats with just enough flavor to complement but not overpower the meat.    This taco delivered exactly that.  And the Tacozuela is something you have just gotta try.    Sweet, juicy plantains atop beef, black beans, guac, and queso fresco.   It's new, so hopefully my first order from Pabellon can help you make the decision to give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacozuela
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carnitas and beef tacos

ZzDIUmm99DL4ldyxq4CtpA.text: I tried Pabellon for the first time last night and thought it was good but not the best Mexican I've had. I ordered the enchiladas with red sauce and the shredded beef, it came with black beans and rice. It was all very good, but pretty cold by the time I got home with it. The chips and guacamole were decent but there wasn't enough to be worth $10. My mom and sister ordered the fish, and chorizo tacos and both were not very filled with ingredients. The flavors were good but there were many empty bites with just tortilla.

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Enchiladas and chips &amp; guacamole

PJWE7yrVsKudfwqA2UEYtQ.text: Oh wow this place was fantastic! My husband and I ordered a bunch if different items so that we can try a variety! We ordered the chicken guac arepa, chips and guac, beef empanada, cheese sticks and an enchilada plate! Everything was pipping hot and made fresh! The service was great too! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Enchiladas
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Arepa
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheese sticks

4v-weF3ZVXlwXZIO9EX3sw.text: What a great little place. Met a friend for lunch. I had been there before when it was Bea's Taco Town. I was impressed with how sparkling clean the place was (although it was nice before ...). I had a chicken arepas, something I had never tried and it was so good. Crispy cornbread on the outside, black beans, cheese and delicious, moist and nicely seasoned filling inside. My friend's mole chicken was beautifully plated and she reported that it was delicious too. I hope to return soon!

DK8C3GdeKeMI_u2eJp2LaQ.text: So good. Arepa's are new to me, kind of like a pupusa but even better in my book. This place is for real and the people there are great!

WnqHmBL4uVheb1-q1GShtg.text: Great new neighborhood spot in Banksville (this used to be Bea's Taco Town, now under new management, and before that was a different place). I haven't had the pleasure of Venezuelan food before so I went with the pabellon arepa; it totally hit the spot. Excellent service, affordable, casual, plenty of booths and tables to sit down and eat, and they also do take out and delivery through GrubHub. My only concern is that this location can be awkward to get to because you can't make a left into it from Banksville Rd - you have to do a U Turn by Kuhn's to get there if you aren't headed north, which may be a reason the previous businesses there struggled to survive. We will definitely be back to support this place.

QZYwofvhZ-lFtor5FUOenQ.text: Diamond in the rough. Not that I don't love Banksville- but it's hard to stop and smell the roses on Banksville Road.  Traffic moves quickly- unless it's rush hour of course.  And if you're in the slow moving outbound traffic (during lunch and dinner hours)- you're on the opposite side of the divided road. It can be a little hard to spot- and hard to get to from the opposite side.  Strike while the iron is hot, I always say. Next time you think about driving by- don't.  While Pittsburgh is growing and diversifying- we definitely don't (yet) have a strong foothold in more traditional Latin American flavors. It's okay not to be familiar- but not okay to miss out altogether.  Ask questions about the menu! The staff are all very friendly and courteous.  They work hard and that energy is evident, beyond the flavors themselves. The flavors are fantastic and you can get into something that suits every taste- light flavors, bold flavors, all of it.    I love the arepas- they always hit the spot and I don't feel like I need to take a nap afterwards from eating too much.  If you have your reservations about something totally new, go for one of the more Americanized ones like a Philly cheesesteak arepa.  Im also nuts about tostones (part Puerto Rican on my Mom's side) so it's cool to see and taste something so familiar with subtle differences that are delicious.   If you enjoyed it- be sure to write a review.  We need to get the word out there that this is one not to be missed.

5NEGmey5MZkoFNdTrq-q_Q.text: Looking for some place new to try, I came across Pabellon via Yelp. I've driven pasted it several times, but never stopped. After reading several good reviews, I figured why not!?   The service throughout the experience was top notch. We didn't have to wait long for anything.   We couldn't decide on Mexican or Venezuelan so we ordered a bit of everything. Chips & salsa, chips & queso, traditional tacos, shredded beef empanadas, reina pepiada, chido burrito and churros (to go!---so full) My favorite was the shredded beef empanadas. So flavor full!   Oh-did I mention it was BYOB? The server had a bucket ready to go with ice for our drinks as soon as we arrived.   We will definitely go back. I highly recommend to give Pabellon a shot!

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Traditional taco!

EpQAx77DcLDMSKC-5y8Kpg.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch. I haven't been here yet and have been wanting to check it out. I had heard the arepas were the highlight, so that's what I went with. I haven't actually had one before, so I didn't know what I was getting into.  Let me tell you, it was super tasty! It's like a sandwich and panini hybrid but made with corn instead of flour (yay gluten free). I got the signature Pabellon with beef, cheese and plantains. I actually wasn't expecting it to be so big too. It was really filling.   Glad to see them on grubhub and happy they're close to my house. It's an easy spot for lunch or dinner!

fYFlygW-JrrS1IZ2evsAOQ.text: SO. GOOD.   The restaurant itself is uniquely dated, it adds to the experience.  There is a Mexican and a Venezuelan menu... we came hungry and tried both.  Mexican we started with chips and salsa which were weirdly overpriced, but great homemade salsa.  Venezuelan side we got tequenia's, which are such an awesome version of Italian cheese sticks.  Served with a sauce that has thousand island hints.  Also got a shredded chicken empanada that was delish!  For entree's, Mexican we got the super burrito, which was truly SUPER. It's huge and packed with ingredients.  We got the shrimp, but may get shredded beef next times.  On the Venezuelan side I got the Pabellon arepa.  The sweetness of the plantain was so unique with the shredded beef.  This place is seriously delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 5. Super Burrito
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 5. Super Burrito
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tequeos 6 pieces.

p3fUaNj3sD72Y-1-w5O1Fg.text: I was craving some Latin food and headed on over to Pabellon... and was blown away.  This is the only place I've found good arepas aside from my girlfriend's mother's kitchen... In Sucre, Colombia. The food seems a bit pricey for how much you get, but it is sooooo tasty. I followed everyone else's recommendations and got the Arepas Pabellon, Bacon & Yellow Cheese Empanada, and a Tres Leches cake to go with it all.   Super F****** Rico

Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Arepa Pabellon

oS2rAnvwHhK63_Q0uCOtlA.text: My voice was heard! There is music! :) Food here is good! Like I've said before, little different atmosphere. It's BYOB which I love, and prices are very reasonable. The only thing I would change would be the tortilla chips, they just aren't very good! I am also not a fan of the guacamole and salsa (that's my only complaint)

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips and Guacamole
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chew se Cake
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 5. Veggie Tostada

WhErWHbt4tKFU4GePxJPUg.text: When out in the South Hills for an appointment, I was lucky enough to drive by and see this wonderful new restaurant. So happy I learned about it. I was immediately greeted when I came in the door and was given all the time I need to read the menu. There were so many delicious things. I wanted to try them all. We decided to try the Venezuelan side of the menu since there are almost no authentic Latin American Restaurants in Pittsburgh. So excited to finally have one!  My husband and I really enjoyed it. I got the pabellon and it was really delicious. I loved the Barbacoa or shredded beef and especially the maduros or sweet plantains. Looking forward to trying other things on the menu including the empanadas and the arepas. My husband tried the pabellon criollo and loved it. It was very similar to mine without the flour tortilla and avocado.   If you like Latin American food, you HAVE to try this place. They offer Mexican food too, which looked really good.

oe2eqUWGXBkQ8WsQ_EiJ6Q.text: I went in here and the service was a little slow. When I finally got the menu, it was the Mexican menu. I came in to try their Venezuelan food. Unfortunately, the only items that I was able to order were the arepas. I was i formed that if i wanted empanadas i would have to wait longer.   I decided to get the Pabellon arepa. When I received it, the beans were spilling out of the arepa and the cornmeal which could've been a little more crispy, was soggy. The flavors were present and the arepa was generously filled. I would come back here again to give this place a second chance however, I prefer cilantro et ajo much more then here for Venezuelan cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pabellon arepa
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Generously filled pabellon arepa

16O_X7vWT3BYX4CtAAtsFQ.text: Pabellon has taken over the space formerly known as Bea Taco town. Online ordering is available through Grubhub. During my visit I was shown both the Mexican menu and the Venezuelan menu. The Mexican menu has more to offer but I wanted to try Venezuelan. The Venezuelan menu had no prices affixed to it so I asked the man at the register and was given the prices.  Prices seem very reasonable so I ordered a reina pepiada arepa which consists of chicken breast with various seasonings and an avocado sauce.  As a side I ordered the plantains covered in white cheese. Since I was eating in I was directed to the dining area. The seating area is vast and there is one wall still being redone. They also play music of the country.  I did glance at both menus and saw that they had vegetarian options available as well. I was served my food in a reasonable amount of time. The plantains were spot on good for only $5.00! My arepa came with the Venezuelan flag toothpick on it making it quite cute. The chicken in the arepa seemed cold so I went to inquire about it. I was told that they consider this type of arepa like a salad even though the arepa was warm. I explained to him that this should be noted on the menu since there is also another arepa also served with the interior cold. It was good but reminded me of chicken salad since the chicken was cold.  I decided upon dessert and found out that the only offerings they had for dessert were three milks cake or chorros. I opted for the former and believe me it was rich and so fresh! As I was going to pay I saw a sign in the back that said "Welcome new concept, coming soon." i inquired about that sign and learned that the business plans to get a coffee bar set up at the ordering counter and eventually serve breakfast.   For now they only have one gender neutral restroom-(no place for purses ladies), which is always my pet peeve. The counter man explained to me they are actually working on getting another one per inspector guidelines which is currently in the works. They have no WiFi and cellular reception is pretty bad.  I paid for my lunch and offered suggestions for improvement. Learning they have only one Venezuelan menu which is shared it should have the prices on it and have more of them. Likewise items that are cold should be marked as such. When in doubt I suggest ask before ordering.  It was a descent lunch and next visit will try out their Mexican selections. Located on Banksville Road headed towards town they have their own private lot. If coming from the opposite direction then I would suggest to drive to Kuhn's market and plaza, make a left into it and then pull straight out at the far end and you will be in the right direction.

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Three milks cake-very good!
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. the arepa definition on the menu
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Arepa menu

zI7I_lhtn_VUpaH04bgYBg.text: This was my family and my first time at this restaurant and it was amazing! My kids immediately commented on the quality in customer service and how friendly and inviting the server was.  The outside is quaint and you could easily miss it driving by, but the i side is clean and well decorated.  The food was INCREDIBLE... full of flavor. It felt like a home-cooked meal. We ordered a chicken empanada, two arepas (reina pepiada & sifrina), two orders of taquenos (the best cheese sticks we've ever had!), a chimichanga, and enchiladas. Everything was a 10/10! Note: the arepas are stuffed and one was more than enough! Om behalf of my whole family, we highly recommend. We will be back!

uBGH4qOruIsVg4YBzM4F1A.text: Go to this place!!! Seriously.   Options for every palate and its authentic.   Staff was helpful with the less well known dishes and made GREAT recommendations.   Support this unique local joint.

5j5-g61XFCBdhCKzIKKtJA.text: I haven't had arepas since I lived in Tampa but would visit my cousin in Lauderdale and we would hit up the arepa truck after a night of drinking at all the bars. These are fantastic. I ordered 3 different ones and all were incredible. The empanadas were great too as well as fried plantains and of course rice and beans. Next time I will flip the menu over and try the Mexican food too. My step dad is Mexican so I'll check back with another review after we try the Mexican side and see if as legit as the Venezuelan side. Love it. Oh and the owner is super cool and friendly.  This would be a great place to have cater a party with a bunch of empanadas and arepas with some beans rice and plantains on the side.

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu. Order at front. Place is supposed to be amazing. Can&#39;t wait. Very friendly people

GxlStMQud5vhwF3rXCTjmA.text: An unpretentious place right on 19 South.  Plenty of parking.  Serving both Venezuelan and Mexican food.  Try the shredded beef empanadas.  Yum.  I enjoyed the a dinner plate called Pabellon Criollo with shredded beef, black beans and rice and fried plantains.  It included a couple baby sized arepas (fried breads).  Ask for a side of crema/sour cream.  We took slices of beautiful tres leches cake and flan for later.  Waiter was super friendly and made good recommendations.  There was a steady stream of customers dining in and taking out.  A good sign that they are developing a strong following.

e7UPVkYr3eiYa_72oz5ldA.text: I have never had Venezuelan food before and was really wanting to try an arepa. We came for dinner on a Friday night and ordered from the menu. I ordered an arepa and my companion, wanting taquitos, ordered golden tacos (which are fried like taquitos.) The tacos came with rice (which was cold so she didn't eat it) and black beans, and some lettuce and cheese on top as a garnish.  The arepa was by itself and small, although it tasted great especially the plantains. The two dishes were very close in price and I assumed it was a dinner plate but no.  I doubt there was much more than 2 ounces of meat in the arepa.

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pabellon arepa
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips y salsa
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

tbpdg4HMoIUiJtCQOYj9-A.text: Definitely improved over the previous management!  When it was Bea Taco I ordered a chorizo taco that had maybe a tablespoon of meat.  This place's tacos are overflowing with delicious chorizo.  The choriqueso was wonderful too as was the bacon and yellow cheese empanada.  My only complaint was I ordered my tacos with only beans and rice and they still came loaded with onions and cilantro.  Luckily I was able to pick them off.  Delivery time was reasonable and food arrived still warm.  Overall I definitely recommend this place and will be ordering again!  Prices are a bit high but the food was very filling and I had a couple days worth of leftovers.

EEiTga6x_N3_MdxXyFkl4w.text: Just hard to stay away!   The Arepas is so good.   Stopped in for dinner take out.  The young man at the counter was very friendly and helpful.  The Pabellon and Carita arepas along with the Tostones were just so flavorfull.  They give you a mild sauce and have a really hot sauce if you are brave.  If you have a chance be sure to stop in and try an arepas, you won't be sorry. The do use Grubhub for delivery.

photos.caption: Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Arepas &amp; Tostones
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Potosinas
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Catina arepa

bSXu29-g9rz9jXSiWjur9g.text: So our first taste of Venezuelan food in PGH.  I love the plantains with the Pabellon dish.  The empanada is made with masa, unlike the flour that I am used to.  The ingredients are allowed to exude its flavor because it is lightly salted.  It has a Mexican menu which we will try next time.

Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lane llon Criollo (Whole Plate)
Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Arepas de Pollo

vxTx6-ufyk86upJaB1srgA.text: AMAZING arepas! This place is definitely worth checking out and there are a lot of great options for food. There is Venezuelan and Mexican food on their menu. Since there are less options for Venezuelan food in the area, I definitely recommend trying some arepas or empanadas. Both were delicious!

MbgjMEVSo_s4UKn6OkVF8w.text: Wow the food is extremely good. Burritos were around $10.  Service seemed a little inexperienced but getting there. Arepas were so delicious.

bjDTWyeuBv6clOS8KSAUgQ.text: Two down and two to go. Eating my way through the Venezuelan and Colombian restaurants in Pittsburgh has been fun so far. It's a nice break if you want to try something in between Argentina and Mexico in Pitt. Pabellon takes over from Bea Taco, but maintains the familiar Mexican menu to increase its appeal. The restaurant is run by Venezuelans and features a very extensive arepa selection. The arepas were crunchy on the outside and well proportioned. This is the right way to make an arepa! The Catira and Pabellon were excellent. If you have never tried cheese sticks from Venezuela, try the tequenos. Their vegetarian options are limited, but ok for lunch. Service was slow but friendly. I will be back to try their other Venezuelan staples.

Photo of Pabellon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Arepa Caprese - one of the veggie options
